segment: PBS is committed to protecting the private information of our web site visitors. From the pbs.org homepage to more than 150,000 pages of content produced by our affiliates, the "pbs.org" domain remains a safe haven. The PBS.org web site adheres to a strict policy for ensuring the privacy of personally identifiable information and preserving the integrity of this online medium. Here we explain the type of information collected from PBS.org, how that information may be used, how you can access or modify that information, and how that information is protected.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides a general introduction to the privacy policy, outlining commitments to privacy and protection of personally identifiable information without detailing specific practices or categories.

segment: I. WHICH SITES ARE COVERED BY THIS POLICY-   This Privacy Policy applies to PBS.org ("Site"). Please note that our Site may contain links to sponsor organizations and PBS Member Stations. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of those web sites. We encourage you to review the privacy policy of any organization before submitting your personal information to them.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides an introductory statement about the scope of the privacy policy, indicating which site is covered and advising users to review other sites' privacy policies.

segment: II. WHAT INFORMATION DO WE GATHER-   PBS collects two types of information from visitors to the Site: (A) Personally Identifiable Information, and (B) Non-personally Identifiable Information (information such as IP Addresses and cookies, which allow for a better use of the Site). Uses of this information are discussed in Section III.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of Personally Identifiable Information and Non-personally Identifiable Information, such as IP Addresses and cookies, from visitors to the site.

segment: A. Personally Identifiable Information   PBS will not collect personally identifiable information from you, other than what you supply to us on a voluntary basis upon request. Personally identifiable information includes, but is not limited to, name, address, e-mail address, telephone number, and credit card information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that PBS collects personally identifiable information only when supplied voluntarily by the user, indicating explicit collection on the website with identifiable personal information.

segment: Registration for our website :   Our Site may at times require a free registration, which enables full access to the information and resources offered on our Site. A unique email address must be supplied to register.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of a unique email address during the registration process on the website to enable full access to its resources, which falls under first-party collection/use for basic service/feature purposes.

segment: Paid Products and Services :   While the majority of our Site is free, we may charge fees for select products and services. To enable the purchase of these and other products, we collect your telephone number, e-mail address, billing address and credit card information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of identifiable contact and financial information explicitly for the purpose of enabling purchases, indicating a basic service feature for users with an account.

segment: Support of Member Stations and other public broadcasting entities :   On certain pages within the Site, PBS may offer visitors the opportunity to make a donation in support of public broadcasting entities, programs and series, or to order products, subscriptions or other services offered by PBS Member Stations. If a visitor chooses to make a donation or order such other products or services, PBS will collect and store your telephone number, e-mail address, billing address and credit card information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of identifiable personal information such as telephone number, e-mail address, billing address, and credit card information when a user makes a donation or orders products/services on the PBS website. The purpose is related to supporting public broadcasting entities, and the collection is explicit as it occurs when the user chooses to make a transaction.

segment: Forums, Feedback and Content Submissions :   On some pages of the Site, you can submit content to be published, make community postings, comments, suggestions, and vote. We may collect name, address, and e-mail addresses in connection with these activities.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of identifiable contact information (name, address, email) when users submit content or participate in community activities on the website. This collection is for the purpose of service operation and security, and is implicitly done as part of user interaction.

segment: Your submission of others' Personally Identifiable Information :   On some pages of the Site, you can submit information about other people. For example, you may submit a person's name and email address to send an article. Additionally, you may purchase a gift online and submit the person's name, address and telephone number for delivery. This information will only be used for the stated purpose.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of personal information about others, such as names, email addresses, and phone numbers, for specific purposes like sending articles or delivering gifts. The collection is explicit and identifiable, used only for the stated purpose.

segment: Contests, Sweepstakes and Special Offers :   On occasion, we may collect personal information from users in connection with optional (i.e., you opt-in to participate in these offers) sweepstakes, contests or special offers. Such information will be used as indicated at the time of collection.

model_analysis.explanation: The policy describes the collection of personal information for contests, sweepstakes, and special offers, which users opt into, indicating explicit collection and identifiable information for specific purposes.

segment: Listservs and E-mail Newsletters:   On occasion, we may collect personal information from users in connection with optional (i.e. you opt-in to subscribe to these services) listservs and e-mail newsletters. Such information will be used as indicated at the time of collection.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of personal information for listservs and e-mail newsletters, indicating an opt-in choice, explicit collection mode, and identifiable contact information.

segment: B. Non-personally Identifiable Information    In addition to information that you provide to us, we may also collect and store certain non-personally identifiable information automatically when using the Site. This information helps us improve the experience you and other visitors have with the Site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the automatic collection of non-personally identifiable information on the website, which is used to improve user experience. This implies implicit collection for service operation and security purposes, and the information is likely aggregated or anonymized.

segment: For example, we may collect your IP address, browser information and reference site domain, as well as related information such as the date on which you visit the Site. This information does not identify you personally and is only used in the aggregate.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of IP address and browser information on the website, which is used in aggregate form for analytics or research purposes. The data is not personally identifiable.

segment: As is common practice among web sites, we use "cookies" and similar technologies. Cookies are text files which store your preferences. No personal information is ever stored in a PBS cookie, even if you have entered your name or email address on other parts of the Site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment explains the use of cookies for storing user preferences but clarifies that no personal information is stored in these cookies, indicating collection on the website for personalization purposes without storing identifiable information.

segment: You can generally prevent cookies from being used by changing the settings in your web browser, but please be aware that by doing so you may be unable to fully utilize the Site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment informs users that they can prevent cookies by adjusting their browser settings, which falls under browser/device privacy controls.

segment: III. HOW DO WE USE INFORMATION GATHERED ON THE SITE-   Except as expressly set forth in our policies, we will not willfully disclose your personally identifiable information to any third party without first receiving your permission. We will never sell, rent, or swap your personally identifiable information with non-affiliated third parties for their own purposes.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment states that personally identifiable information will not be disclosed to third parties without permission, and it will not be sold, rented, or swapped with non-affiliated third parties.

segment: In terms of our own use of information, we may use your personally identifiable information for the activities described in the previous sections, and for internal purposes and marketing, promotional and fundraising purposes in support of public broadcasting.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates the use of personally identifiable information for marketing, promotional, and fundraising purposes, which falls under the category of 'Marketing'.

segment: We will typically explain the extent of use at the time you are asked to provide personal information. If you do not want this information to be collected or used by us for these purposes, you can simply "opt out." Under certain circumstances, opting out may prevent your participation in activities for which personal information is needed, as in contests.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the user's ability to opt out of the collection or use of personal information by the first party, indicating control over first-party data collection.

segment: In certain cases, we contract with other companies to provide services on our behalf. These service providers may maintain customer databases which may hold Site users' e-mail addresses, including:   viewers, listeners and members;  Site visitors who have provided them to PBS by registering at our Site or signing up for a newsletter or listserv;  audience members who e-mail questions about membership or programs;  donors who submit online contributions; or  online buyers who make a purchase.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment explains that PBS contracts with other companies to provide services, which involves sharing users' email addresses with these service providers.

segment: We (which includes our service providers) will use these addresses to respond to the general purposes for which we collected the information, to provide services and to operate the Site, including to respond to inquiries, to process credit card payments and billing, shipping, e-mail distribution, list processing and analysis, promotions management, to send information about PBS programs, Site, services, membership or to correspond about a purchase or product offers. For example, shoppbs.org uses a third party fulfillment agent to manage orders, credit card processing, order fulfillment and shipping, and related tasks.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how the company collects and uses addresses for various operational purposes, including responding to inquiries and processing payments, indicating it's collected on the website for service operation and security.

segment: Our service providers have access to your personally identifiable information as necessary to provide certain services on our behalf. They are required to maintain the privacy of all such information in their possession or control and can only use the information on our behalf for the purpose that we have contracted them, for example processing your order or sending you a series newsletter. They are not authorized to use your information for any other purpose.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment describes sharing personally identifiable information with service providers for specific purposes like processing orders or sending newsletters. The information is shared with unnamed third parties, and they are authorized to use it only for contracted purposes, indicating 'Receive/Shared with' action and 'Service operation and security' purpose.

segment: Similarly, personally identifiable information provided in connection with a donation intended for a program, series or Member Station, or for purposes of ordering products, subscriptions or other services offered by the PBS Member Stations, will be shared by PBS or by such PBS Member Stations with third parties who perform services to process the donation or the applicable order. Also, in transmitting your donation or order to the local Member Station PBS may share your personally identifiable information with the Member Station for order or donation processing.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing personally identifiable information with third parties for the purpose of processing donations or orders, indicating identifiable information is shared with unnamed third parties for service operation and security.

segment: At times, we make customer mailing lists available to carefully screened companies whose products or services might interest individuals who have shopped on the Site.  If you prefer that we not share your information in this way, please contact us.

model_analysis.explanation: The policy segment indicates that customer mailing lists are shared with third-party companies, which falls under the 'Receive/Shared with' action for third parties.

segment: We, or our service providers, may release personal identification information if we believe in good faith that the law or legal process requires it, we have received a valid administrative request from a law enforcement agency, or such release is necessary to protect anyone's rights, property or safety.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the release of personal identification information to comply with legal requirements or to protect rights, property, or safety, which falls under the purpose of legal requirement in third-party sharing.

segment: On certain pages, we offer visitors the opportunity to provide comments or other user-generated content on blogs and articles. Any information that you disclose when posting a message to these areas, along with the screen name or ID used, becomes public. In addition, the information that you disclose in these areas may be used by us for promotional and marketing purposes. We are not responsible for any personally identifiable information that you choose to disclose in these public areas.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection and use of user-generated content on the website, which includes identifiable personal information such as screen names or IDs. This information is used for marketing purposes, and users explicitly provide it when posting comments.

segment: We reserve the right to send you e-mail relating to your account status. This includes order confirmations, renewal/expiration notices, notices of credit card problems, other transactional e-mails and notifications about major changes to our Site. If you have registered for online discussions or other services, you may receive e-mail specific to your participation in those activities.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the collection and use of email addresses for sending account-related notifications and updates, which is a first-party collection and use for service operation and security purposes.

segment: We offer several e-mail newsletters and listservs. If you no longer wish to receive a specific newsletter, you may opt out by following the "unsubscribe" instructions located near the bottom of each newsletter.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes an opt-out mechanism for users to stop receiving newsletters, indicating a user control over first-party use of their contact information.

segment: We use non-personally identifiable information, such as IP addresses or demographic information (zip codes for example) to tailor our Site to the interests/locations of our users and to measure traffic within our Site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection and use of non-personally identifiable information, such as IP addresses and demographic data, to customize the site and analyze traffic. The information is used in an aggregated or anonymized form for personalization and analytics purposes.

segment: PBS uses the content from the cookies to deliver relevant local resources, remember browser preferences, and improve our visitors' experiences on the Site. PBS does not sell information collected by cookies nor use the information for commerce-related purposes. In addition, PBS will not filter content based on your preferences without permission.

model_analysis.explanation: PBS collects cookies on their website to deliver localized resources and remember preferences, indicating they use cookies for personalization/customization. They do not sell this information or use it for commerce, and they require permission to filter content, suggesting an opt-in choice type for content filtering.

segment: PBS uses cookies at the following times:   A cookie may automatically localize pbs.org to the PBS station nearest you. You can choose to have your computer remember a different station or no station at all at any time.  If you watch a video clip or listen to an audio clip on pbs.org, a cookie may remember which media player and type of clip you prefer to use on your computer. You can change your video and audio preferences at any time, or choose a player each time you view of listen to a clip.  A cookie will tell us which pages you visit and the amount of time between each page visit. The cookie does not remember any information about you or your computer; it just helps us at PBS monitor Site usage and traffic; for example, it allows us to measure the number of repeat visitors to pbs.org in a given month. This data is only used in the aggregate.

model_analysis.explanation: PBS uses cookies to localize content, remember user preferences, and track site usage, with users having control over certain settings. The data is used in aggregate, indicating anonymization.

segment: Additionally, cookies may be used on pay sites to (1) identify the terms of any special offers you may have obtained, such as price discount or free trial period AND/OR (2) automatically sign you in so that you do not have to enter a username and password each time you visit.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of cookies on the website to remember user preferences and login information, which involves collecting identifiable data (cookies) implicitly for personalization purposes.

segment: IV. HOW CAN I ACCESS OR CORRECT INFORMATION-   Access to personally identifiable information that is collected from our Site may be accessible for a limited period of time from the point of collection, such as where a user provides an e-mail address in order to receive an e-mail newsletter or a reminder about an upcoming program or event. In other cases, personally identifiable information may be maintained, edited and deleted at the user's discretion at any time after the information has been submitted to PBS. For example, if you created a password-protected account within our Site, you may be able to access that account to review the information you provided and make corrections and updates as necessary. However this feature is not available throughout our Site where the user is not asked to create an account. Therefore, if at any time, you prefer not to receive e-mail from a service that you subscribed to without creating a personal account, simply get out by following the unsubscribe options at the bottom of each e-mail.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses how users can access, correct, and delete their personally identifiable information, especially through account management features, indicating user control over their data.

segment: You may also send an e-mail or letter to the following e-mail or street address requesting access to or correction of your personally identifiable information. For verification purposes please include your first name, last name, e-mail address and the password you use for said service.     2100 Crystal Drive   Arlington, VA 22202   Email us by completing our feedback form   www.pbs.org

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides users with the option to request access to or correction of their personally identifiable information, indicating an 'Edit information' access type within the 'Profile data' scope.

segment: V. HOW IS MY INFORMATION PROTECTED-   PBS is committed to ensuring the security of the data provided to us by Site users. To prevent unauthorized access, maintain data accuracy and ensure the appropriate use of information, we have put in place appropriate physical, electronic and managerial procedures to protect the information we collect online.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the commitment to data security and mentions the implementation of physical, electronic, and managerial procedures to protect information, which fits the 'Generic' security measure.

segment: VI. DO YOU HAVE ADDITIONAL CHILDREN'S GUIDELINES-   PBS.org is a general audience Site and does not knowingly collect or store personally identifiable information about children under the age of 13.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that the site is a general audience site and does not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13, addressing guidelines related to children.

segment: Any of our sites that are directed to children under the age of 13 (e.g., PBSKids site) comply with COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act) standards, which are in addition to PBS.org policies. For complete guidelines on children's information collection, please visit the PBS KIDS PRIVACY POLICY.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies compliance with COPPA for sites directed to children under the age of 13, indicating a focus on a specific audience, namely children.

segment: VII. ACCEPTANCE OF PBS.ORG PRIVACY POLICY TERMS AND CONDITIONS   By using this Site, you signify your agreement to the terms and condition of this pbs.org Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to the terms and conditions, please do not use the Site. We reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to change, modify, add, or remove portions of this policy at any time. Please check this page periodically for any changes. Your continued use of pbs.org following the posting of any changes to these terms shall signify your acceptance of those changes. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the possibility of changes to the privacy policy and indicates that continued use of the site signifies acceptance of those changes, categorizing it as a privacy relevant change.

segment: VIII. TERMS OF USE   Please also make sure to read pbs.org's TERMS OF USE to understand the additional terms and conditions which apply to your use of our Site.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment is providing a general introduction or reference to the terms of use, which is a common practice in privacy policies to ensure users are aware of additional conditions.

segment: The Privacy Policy posted on this Site was updated on or about May 11, 2009.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the privacy policy was updated on a specific date, which is a general notice in the privacy policy. The type of change and user choice regarding the change are unspecified.
